subject: Re: [junit] Native Library already loaded in another classloader
msgSnippet: I was under the impression that a native class should only be loaded once and that is why most loadLibrary calls are done in a wrapper class that loads the
messageBody:
I was under the impression that a native class should only be loaded once and that is why most
loadLibrary calls are done in a wrapper class that loads the library in its static initializer so
that it is only loaded once.

On Fri,
26 Jan 2001, you wrote: Hi,

The code I'm testing calls System.loadLibrary( "JNIExperiment" )
once. One test run gets green. But every second(!) time I hit the
TestRunner Run button I get the following exception:

java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: Native Library JNIExperiment.dll
already loaded in another classloader.

What to do?

Regards

Marc
